description: Virtual Sapiens makes training stick through our Train, Practice, Perform AI coaching platform. Our coaching platform supports skills validation and integration through immersive, AI Role Plays, and in the work flow feedback. With Virtual Sapiens, employees improve in measurable and sustainable ways, at scale.
problem_statement: Corporate training programs are one size fits all and 'check the box'. Real ROI is impossible to measure and miscommunication, lost productivity and low engagement leads to over $1.2 Trillion in lost revenue opportunities. Our platform meets a gap in market when it comes to the integration and validation of essential skills at mid to large companies. With our platform integrated into new hire onboarding, general employee upskilling and manager training, companies empower their teams to thrive, own their impact and deliver at scale.

market_opportunity.justification:
Target customer: Talent development, learning and development are our biggest buyers. They are getting pressure to report out on the ROI of trainings and ensure trainings are supporting their workforce for real impact. To date, many trainings are 'check the box' with no real way (apart from surveys no one fills out) to measure improvement across a series of learning frameworks and methodologies. Our platform supports this through easy to customize role plays and skills validation exercises. Our platform also supports a variety of communication contexts (phone calls, in person and virtual) providing the more robust and nuanced feedback across nonverbal, verbal and vocal metrics.
Market size: The US L&D/training market currently sits at around $98B. Our more specific, bottom up market analysis shows $2.2B in combined market potential with L&D/sales training, Sales training firms and LMS systems we can integrated into.

product_differentiation.justification:
Competitors: Yoodli - raised too much money too early, we regularly get their disgruntled customers who are disappointed in their 'close the deal and then vanish' approach.
TalkMeUp - sub par product - no real value.
AI Real Play - Too focused on unsustainable and expensive technologies at the expense of actual user appetite.
In-market since: Yes, we have been in market with our solutions since 2022. We had various versions of our MVP in the market since our inception in 2020.

go_to_market_traction.justification:
Traction: Over the last 6 months we have increased our revenues by 100%.
Customers: We have 10 direct B2B clients ranging from eBay to HP. 
We have 5 existing whitelabel reseller partners ranging from BTS to The Ariel Group (with blue chip clients including BCG, American Tower, AstraZeneca, Coca-Cola and more)
We have an additional 4 B2B clients in pilot and are actively onboarding 2 new reseller partners.
Pricing: All of the above are paying. Pricing structure is an annual service/customization fee and per person/per year platform access fee. We have add-ons for additional role play minutes for anything above 30 minutes per month.

strategic_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s thesis around digital transformation and workforce innovation.

red_flags: Long sales cycles and intertia. Fear of new AI policies even if we have built a highly secure and privacy first product, there seems to be a lack of education and understanding (although we are quickly seeing positive improvement in this space and an eagerness to apply AI in a way that leads to measurable results)

We need more internal champions to help us navigate complex, enterprise level deals. We also have a gap in how to set ourselves up for more rapid growth. We are very good at managing our funds, being scrappy and yielding exceptional results with some of the world's biggest companies. We would greatly benefit from some strong championship in a noisy market.

gtm_support_potential.justification:
We are in a perfect position to expand our reach and close more deals. Our deployment is simple and streamlined, our product delights users and buyers alike. 
Given our smaller size, we have a hard time cutting through the noise and getting to the demo stage. Once we are able to showcase our product, our close rate is high. Main goals would be to close at least one six figure deal. We are also looking to implement a more effective GTM strategy within the HR/People development space.

acceleration_readiness.justification: Product and team are early but show clear focus, alignment, and testable GTM hypotheses. Well-positioned for structured SV support.
